title: Replace deprecated apache HttpClient with HttpURLConnection.
message:
Replace deprecated apache HttpClient with HttpURLConnection.
The whole org.apache.http package became deprecated in Android API 22. It's recommended to use HttpURLConnection instead and since that works well on API >= 15, this patch replaces the apache package for all API versions.

message: Use exact alarms for notifications regardless of API version.

message: Release version 0.12.3

message:

message:

title: Update SDK and tools to (API) version 22 (Android 5.1)
message: Update SDK and tools to (API) version 22 (Android 5.1)

title: Increases the minimum refresh frequency to 15 minutes.
message:
Increases the minimum refresh frequency to 15 minutes.
* Also increases the default refresh frequency to 20 minutes. Implementing data refreshing as a background service resulted in extreme traffic increase. As a countermeasure, and because it is a more sane minimum value, the minimum refresh frequency has been increased to 15 minutes. This is prone to further increases in the future.
* Added upgrade receiver to perform one-time actions when new versions get installed
* Added filter in broadcast receivers to only respond to valid actions.
* Increased release version to v0.12.2

title: Change alarm Intents to contain event information.
message:
Change alarm Intents to contain event information.
Event information is now included as Intent extras and do not longer need to be fetched from the service's mapping since this seemed to cause problems in some cases.
Fixes #32

title: Updates documentation and increases robustness.
message: Updates documentation and increases robustness.

title: Fixes layout on Android versions below 5.0.
message:
Fixes layout on Android versions below 5.0.
The function setBackgroundDrawable(…) does change a View's padding when a padded background is set, but does NOT change it if the background is removed or if it is updated to a background without padding. Since the background drawables introduced in ca86a6811a87c3fcaa4a4454d31eaa1ffe2753b6 leverage padding to achieve the desired layout, objects previously holding the currently running show have to be reset to the default padding values if another background is added to them.
Unfortunately, the necessary method to do this in the widget is not available for API levels below 16, so there might still occur distortion on API 15 devices.
Fixes #40

title: Version bump to v0.12.1 for release.
message: Version bump to v0.12.1 for release.

title: Better visual indicator for the currently running show.
message:
Better visual indicator for the currently running show.
The currently running show is now additionally indicated by lines above and beyond the list entry.
Closes #37

title: Smoother service handling on app updates and widget adding.
message:
Smoother service handling on app updates and widget adding.
In the corner case that the app is installed but never run before adding a widget, the widget now starts the data service itself _once_ to fetch initial data if possible.
Services are now started automatically after an app version updates, the same way they are after started after device reboots.

title: Only display status messages (Toasts) in-app.
message:
Only display status messages (Toasts) in-app.
The DataService displayed some status messages like "download failed" even if the app screen was not running. This could lead to confusion because it is unclear what app the message belongs to. Those messages are now displayed in-app only.
Fixes #38

title: Micro optimizations (fixed lint warnings...)
message: Micro optimizations (fixed lint warnings...)

title: Improved widget self update. Fixed typo.
message:
Improved widget self update. Fixed typo.
Previously, the widget scheduled a self-update at the end of the currently running show in order to update/move the "currently running" indicator. If the schedule has a gap after the currently running show, an update at it's end would remove the indicator but would not schedule another self-update. The self-update will therefore be be scheduled to the start of the next future show, if no new "currently running" show can be found to minimize the impact of gaps. Of course, the widget will still be updated after new schedule data has been retrieved.

title: Localized date formatting. Removed unnecessary initialization.
message: Localized date formatting. Removed unnecessary initialization.

title: Removed unnecessary increment.
message: Removed unnecessary increment.

title: Major architectural changes for the calendar data management.
message:
Major architectural changes for the calendar data management.
Previously, a fragment was used for data retrieval and caching. To be more efficient and to not require the app to run for data updates (for example to be used by the widget) the data management has been moved into a service. That required a set of changes that mainly affect how data consumers are notified of changes and how updates are requested.
Data loading is now managed by the DataService which runs only for the time of data acquisition (from internal storage or from the network). Caching is managed by the DataHolder which can be observed by other classes. Loading status updates are now published as internal broadcasts using a LocalBroadcastManager from the v4 support library.

title: Introduce locks to prevent write/read conflict.
message:
Introduce locks to prevent write/read conflict.
Addresses #32 but since I can not reproduce it, I'm not exactly sure. I think the bug happens, if the data gets corrupted when it is read while being written at the same time. Needs to be confirmed.

Added a widget that displays the schedule up to 2 shows before and up to 7 shows ahead of the currently running one and only those that air at most one day later.
Closes #11

title: Fixes NullPointerException in DataFragment.
message:
Fixes NullPointerException in DataFragment.
There should no longer be the possibility of a NullPointerException in the async download task as it no longer relies on the DataFragment being attached to an activity but instead stores it's own reference to a Context object for the duration of the download and data processing.

title: Fixes a problem that occurs when upgrading from a previous version.
message:
Fixes a problem that occurs when upgrading from a previous version.
When upgrading from a previous version of the app, old reminders still held references to old Event objects missing the recurringId field. This led to those events not getting their reminder removed if a recurring reminder for that event had been set through another instance and then been tried to remove it.
